meanings.definition: To descend a rock face or other near-vertical surface by using a doubled rope coiled around the body and fixed at a higher point.
meanings.sent1: She rappeled down the cliff with skill and confidence.
meanings.sent2: The experienced climber rappeled down the steep rock effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: As she rappeled down, her hat flew off in the wind!
meanings.sent4: His courage rappeled down the mountain of fear within him.
meanings.sent5: The image of her rappeled descent was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To descend by sliding down a rope, typically as a military exercise.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers rappeled down the wall during their training.
meanings.sent2: They rappeled swiftly to the ground from the helicopter.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the soldiers and rappeled down the curtain.
meanings.sent4: His confidence rappeled down the obstacle in front of him.
meanings.sent5: The idea of teamwork rappeled down the minds of the recruits.
